1.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

2.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
to alter; by implication, to barter, to dispose of
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

3.brief: to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
properly, to boil up; hence, to ferment (with scum); to glow (with redness); to smear with pitch
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament

4.brief: a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme

5.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
to surround, i.e. protect or aid

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

6.brief: to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

7.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

9.brief: to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
a lance (for thrusting, like pitching a tent)
something revolving, i.e. a wheeled vehicle

10.brief: to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

11.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
